names.pinyin: tiao jing huo xue he ji

actions: Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood the Blood and regulates the menses.
With Chuan Xiong, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Strengthens Yang, nourishes Yin, astringes Jing and urine, benefits the marrow and tonifies the Kidneys and Liver.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, relieves pain, clears Heat and cools the Blood.
With Chuan Xiong and Dang Gui, for Blood-Stasis induced gynecological disorders such as immobile abdominal masses and amenorrhea with abdominal pain.
With Xiang Fu, for flank pain, abdominal pain and dysmenorrhea due to Qi and Blood Stagnation.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis and regulates menstruation.
With Chuan Xiong, for pain due to trauma, dysmenorrhea and amenorrhea.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and strengthens the Spleen.
Invigorates the Blood and promotes the movement of Qi.
With Xiang Fu, for Qi Stagnation combined with Blood Stasis.
Spreads and regulates Liver Qi, regulates menstruation and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, tonifies the Blood and moves Qi, for premenstrual symptoms, menstrual pain and irregular menstruation.
With Dang Gui and Chuan Xiong, for irregular menstruation and dysmenorrhea due to Qi and Blood Stasis.

symptoms: Aching, soreness or weakness of low back
Urinary frequency with abundant, clear urine or
Maybe chronic diarrhea or "cock crow" diarrhea
Pain that is fixed, stabbing and /or severe
Blue, dark or purplish discoloration of skin in small or large areas
Tendency to hemorrhage dark blood or clots
manifestations.tongue: Pale and swollen or Red or Purple with possible purple or red spots
manifestations.pulse: Deep and thready - maybe slow or Thready and rapid or Choppy or Wiry and choppy
